About.Name: Anh Pham
About.AboutText: Hi, I am Anh and I’m currently a mechanical engineering student at SPU, and I’m interested in CAD modeling work and Mechanical Construction work, and throughout my education I have gained a lot of experiences with Soildworks and different other analysis programs, like Tracker, Excel, and have a grasp on the MATLAB language. So I am looking for a internship after college that will help me really honed the skills of communication with others for more future positions.

Experience.ExperienceText: Thanks to my college journey I was able to get where I am. Starting with smaller projects like a spaghetti bridge and eventually moving up to Junior Design and creating a linear belt driven rail, and a lead screw lift system. Currently I am working on a combination of a remote controlled rover combined with a mechanical robot arm, and the goal is to hold a construction sign in high traffic areas, and with the help of my CSWA certification I have more confidence in my ability of CADing different models to achieve my goals.
Experience.EducationText: With my Mechanical Engineer education I am hoping to use it to develop world changing technology
Experience.Role: Physics Learning Assistant, Linear Algebra Grader
Experience.EmploymentText: These jobs are a good way for me to remind myself of past knowledge and to support students educationally
Experience.SkillsText: These skills were developed both in and out of classes and it showcase my creatitvity and data tracking skills

Project1.Title: Getting Loaded
Project1.Desc: This project is from junior design and it was a horizontal and vertical system that is design to support people with back and joint pain getting everyday items out of a trunk. The first image is the belt driven linear actuator using stepper motors to move the system back and forth. The second image is the vertical system using a lead screw to move the platform up and down. Finally the third image is for the platform itself using L-Brackets as the support to the lead screw.

Project2.Title: MECS
Project2.Desc: The Mobile construction sign is a 4DOF mechanical arm carrying sign that would periodically switch messages between stop and slow attached to a rover to control traffic and preserve the safety of workers. The first picture is the first prototype of the rover with the 2 DC motors on the inside power the 2 external wheels. The second image is the actual construction sign with LED displaying messages. Finally the last image is the first prototype for the 4DOF Mechanical Arm.
